title: Ticket #6619: Add support for schedd query options in Python bindings
description:
Queries sent to the schedd may specify various query options, but currently this functionality is not exposed in the Python bindings by the htcondor.Schedd.query() method. This ticket will add support for an opts parameter with the following possible enum values: 

   htcondor.QueryOpts.Default
   htcondor.QueryOpts.DefaultMyJobsOnly
   htcondor.QueryOpts.AutoCluster
   htcondor.QueryOpts.GroupBy
   htcondor.QueryOpts.SummaryOnly

In particular, the glideinWMS project would like to utilize the GroupBy functionality to (hopefully) significantly improve scalability when the front-end queries busy VO schedds containing a very large number of jobs.

A future child ticket will add these options to the htcondor.Schedd.xquery() method.
remarks:
2018-Mar-29 05:33:01 by bbockelm:
Hi Todd,

Actually, I think we should strongly, strongly discourage use of the query method (or rewrite it as a small wrapper on top of xquery) given the additional load it places on the schedd.

Especially folks we collaborate closely with like gWMS should be able to migrate.

Brian

2018-May-10 14:48:02 by tannenba:
Re comment above about query() vs xquery() : nowadays they both place the same load on the schedd, since query() now also uses the more efficient "V3" query protocol when talking to the schedd just like xquery().
